question:
High job demands, stress and sense of commitment are among the main reasons people go to work when they are ill. This way they accomplish important tasks, but may infect others or get some serious health problems themselves.

In your opinion should people go to work if they are sick?

Support your point of view with relevant examples from your knowledge or experienc
text: The pie charts provide information about annual expenditure of a British school in three given years (1981, 1991 and 2001).

Overall, the charts present that majority of the budget was spent on teacher salaries while few expenses were for insurance in all the years considered. In addition, money used for furniture and equipment was fluctuating.

Regarding the major and minor spending, the school spent the largest amount of budget on teacher salaries; on the other hand, it used the least amount of money in insurance. In 1981, teacher salaries had comprised of 40%. The number had slightly increased to 50% in 1991 before it fell down to 45% in 2001. In contrast, the budget employed for insurance had started at 2% in 1981. It then rose to 3% and 8% in 1991 and 2001, respectively.

Turning to the expenditure for furniture and equipment, the percentage was fluctuating over the given period. Accounted for 15%, the budget had been for furniture and equipment in 1981. The number had plummeted to 5% in the next ten years. Finally, in 2001, it dramatically jumped to 23%.
